checklist_title: HC-RS Bias and Fairness Evaluation Checklist

items.question: Does training data reflect target population demographics?
items.notes: Simulated data - requires validation on real diverse cohorts

items.question: Are all protected groups (sex, age, ethnicity) adequately represented?
items.notes: Sex and age balanced, ethnicity data not fully captured

items.question: Is there sufficient representation from underserved populations?
items.notes: Requires external validation in diverse populations

items.question: Is AUC similar across demographic subgroups (<0.05 difference)?
items.notes: Internal CV shows similar performance across sex and age groups

items.question: Are sensitivity/specificity balanced across groups?
items.notes: No systematic bias detected in training

items.question: Are false positive rates similar across groups?
Are false negative rates similar across groups?
Does the model avoid stereotyping or proxy discrimination?
items.notes: Features are biological/clinical, not socioeconomic proxies

items.question: Are risk thresholds appropriate for all populations?
items.notes: Thresholds based on population averages - may need adjustment for specific groups

items.question: Are recommended interventions accessible to all groups?
items.notes: Some interventions (specialist referral) may have access barriers

items.question: Does the model perpetuate existing healthcare disparities?
Are PRS developed in diverse populations?
items.notes: PRS primarily European ancestry - may transfer poorly

items.question: Are there concerns about genetic determinism messaging?
items.notes: Model emphasizes modifiable factors alongside genetics

items.question: Are there defined thresholds for bias alerts?
items.notes: Alert if AUC difference >0.05 or sensitivity difference >10%

items.question: Is there a response plan for detected bias?
items.notes: Requires model recalibration or subgroup-specific thresholds

recommendations: CRITICAL: Validate PRS performance in non-European populations before deployment
CRITICAL: Conduct external validation with explicit fairness evaluation
HIGH: Implement automated bias monitoring dashboard
HIGH: Develop population-specific risk thresholds if disparities detected
MEDIUM: Create patient-facing materials explaining genetic vs modifiable risk
MEDIUM: Establish specialist referral pathways for underserved populations
